resources.string: We would like to remember you
Daily goal helps you learn more consistently everyday. Don\'t worry, you can change it anytime later on
We can also remind you to practice everyday!
Practice your japanese by memorizing set of characters. Flip all the right pair to win the game.
Learn by guessing various objects in japanese. Be quick before the time runs out!
Complete a lesson with no mistake

Hiragana is the basic Japanese alphabet. It represents every sound in the Japanese language.


In English, each letter usually represents one sound, like k or b. But hiragana characters each represents as syllable. Japanese syllables are usually just a consonant followed by a vowel. 

There are 46 hiragana symbols in Japanese, each with a particular sound but with no independent meaning.

き - KI 
も - MO 
に - NI 
れ - RE 
か - KA

Katakana is mainly used for words imported from foreign languages. Katakana represents the same set of phonetic sounds as Hiragana, but all the characters are different from Hiragana.
\n\nKatakana is tougher to master compared to Hiragana because it is only used for certain words and you do not get nearly as much practice as you do with Hiragana.

ダ - DA 
カ - KA 
ガ - GA 
ツ - TSU 
フ - FU
Japanese Numbers are fairly simple. It advances on a base ten system, so you’ll be able to use the numbers by learning 1 to 10 and then learning expressions for the digits such as 10, 100 and 1,000.

1 ichi 「いち」 
2 ni 「に」 
3 san 「さん」 
4 yon/shi 「よん/し」 
5 go 「ご」 
6 roku 「ろく」 
7 nana/shichi 「なな/しち」 
8 hachi 「はち」 
9 kyuu/ku 「きゅう/く」 
10 juu 「じゅう」 
100 hyaku「ひゃく」 
1,000 sen「せん」 
10,000 man「まん」


12 = 10 + 2 = juuni 「じゅうに」 
43 = 4 + 10 + 3 = yonjuusan 「よんじゅうさん」 
111 = 100 + 10 + 1 = hyakujuuichi 「ひゃくじゅういち」

Once you know about Japanese number, it becomes easier to give time in Japanese.


Append じ (ji) to the number for hour. 
Append ふん/ぷん (fun/pun it depends on the number) to the number for minute. 
Append びょう (byou) to the number for second. However most of the time you will not need to give the seconds of the time. 
ごぜん(gozen) for AM 
ごご(gogo) for PM
01:00 ichiji 「いちじ」 \n03:30 PM gogosanjihan 「ごごさんじはん」 \n04:00 AM gozenyoji 「ごぜんよじ」

To say date in Japanese, you can for example say:


今日は２０２０年２月１１日です


今日は(kyou wa) -> today 
２０２０年 (nisennijuunen) -> year 2020 
２月 (nigatsu) -> February 
１１日 (juuichinichi) -> 11th 
です (desu) -> is the polite form of the copula verb meaning "to be" or "is" 

For year, just write the year concerned and then add 年/ねん (nen) 
For month, just write the month concerned and then add 月/がつ (gatsu) 
For days of month, just use (number + 日/にち nichi) but it is different for 1-10, 14, 20, 24

1st tsuitachi 「ついたち」 
2nd futsuka 「ふつか」 
3rd mikka 「みっか」 
4th yokka 「よっか」 
5th itsuka 「いつか」 
6th muika 「むいか」 
7th nanoka 「なのか」 
8th youka 「ようか」 
9th kokonoka 「ここのか」 
10th tooka 「とおか」 
14th juuyokka 「じゅうよっか」 
20th hatsuka 「はつか」 
24th nijuuyokka 「にじゅうよっか」 
12th juuninichi 「じゅうににち」
Guess the object as many as you can in 60 seconds

It's time to review it all! 

In this section, we will randomly ask 20 questions from all of the lessons that you've cleared. 

Good Luck!

It's time to review it all!


In this section, you will be reviewing all of the lessons that you've cleared. 
We will give you 60 seconds to answer all of the questions!


Good Luck!

Flip the card to reveal a word in japanese or in alphabeth. If you reveal the correct pair then that pair of card will be discarded.\n\nClear all card within 90 seconds in order to win. Don\'t run out of time!
